value: caption=View over Nogliki from the bridge

) is a city in on the island of
, roughly 2/3 up the island. The name is a canny reference to the booming oil business here as it's derived from the indigenous Nivkh word
which means 'smelling-village'. Around 10,000 people live here, and as the intro might suggest - it's one of the main population centers for the Nivkh tribe.

value: ,ICAO:UHSN) for years a rough airstrip, now proudly boasts a brand new 1750 meter paved runway and even a fancy terminal building - all made possible by a multi million dollar investment from the oil industry. SAT Airlines

flies chartered flights with a Dash-8 to Yuzno-Sakhalinsk and occationally Khabarovsk for the oil companies, call +7 (4242) 739-000 to secure a spot on the 5-10 seats usually left for regular passengers.

) 613 kilometers north of Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk sees a daily nighttrain arriving from Yuzhno at 10.45, returning south again at 18.20, the journey takes just over 13 hours, and stops in Tymovsk on the way for bus connections to
. A 6 wheeled bus connects with the train to take you 250 kilometers up a grueling dirt road to
in the far north of the island.

Both the airport and the station are located a few kilometers southwest of the main city in a suburb like area.
shuttle passengers there regularly for a few rubles.

value: content=Housed in a rather shabby looking wooden building, the museum has around 3,000 items up for display in a space of over 200m2. It also serves as a cultural center for the Nivkh tribe, and besides displays of traditional tools, you'll also find Nivkhs studying their own culture and history.
content=Opened in 2005, this rather bizarre and depressing zoo spreads over about a hectare and has 67 species up for display.

There is a central market near the local school on Shkolny Lane,  where you buy fresh produce and other stuff, and the central part of Sovetskaya street are lined with shops, mainly groceries and hardware stores

There are a number of cafes which are equally ready to serve a bite as a drink. If that is all a bit too adventurous for you, you are probably in the wrong place. But fortunately there is a restaurant inside 'Hotel Nogliki' with an English menu.

value: content=Previously Fabrika, both names for a factory, it's the only thing in town that remotely resembles a club. Cover charge 300 rub, girls free on Thursdays
content=3 star hotel with 70 beds, popular with oil workers.
content=55 bed hotel with shared bathrooms down the hall, rusty showers and filthy toilet.

content=This hotel right by the Zoo has 34 beds, and features some bizarre decoration - naked mannequins, a triped out aquarium and tapestry that makes you feel like on speed - search for "Kouban hôtel Nogliki" on youtube for a taste.
) is a volcanic mountain mountain area, and a village, on a tough dirt road north of town, it has a hot spring to boot.
